newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Half Australian state of NSW declared in drought.
newsitem.headline: Half Australian state of NSW declared in drought.

text.p: The proportion of the state of New South Wales (NSW) declared to be drought-affected rose to 50 percent in July from 45 percent in June despite useful rain in some parts of the state, the NSW government said on Tuesday.
The biggest increases in drought areas had been in the northwest plains, the far south coast and the southern Riverina, Agriculture Minister Richard Amery said.
"Fortunately the majority of the wheat belt received good rains which has consolidated the outlook for winter cereal crops," he said in a statement.
Other regions, however, will have limited pasture growth because of the colder weather and are not likely to improve until spring, Amery said.
He said the Southern Oscillation Index (SOI) continued to be strongly negative which is causing concern for spring and summer weather, particularly in the northern half of the state.
The SOI, which is associated the El Nino event now developing, measures air pressure differences between Darwin and Tahiti.
A negative SOI over a period portends drought in eastern Australia.
